intro: Pavetta oblongifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Pavetta oblongifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
